title: Add new admin article template and ensure public visibility after publish

requirements.summary: Add a new long-form English ArticleTemplate entry so it appears in the Admin Article Editor “Start from a Template” dropdown and loads into the editor correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/articleTemplates.ts` includes one new `ArticleTemplate` with a unique `slug`, `title`, `tags`, and non-empty Markdown `content`.
The Admin Article Editor page template selector lists the new template and successfully loads its title/slug/content/author/tags into the editor when selected.
All user-facing text inside the new article content is written in English.
The new template slug does not conflict with any existing template slugs and remains URL-safe (lowercase, hyphenated).

file_operations.description: Add one new `ArticleTemplate` with a unique, URL-safe lowercase-hyphenated `slug`, English `title`, `author`, `tags`, and substantial non-empty Markdown `content`. If including a Markdown image, reference an existing static asset path already used by other templates (e.g., an existing file under frontend/public/assets/generated).

requirements.summary: Ensure an article created from the new template can be saved, published, and then appears for anonymous visitors on /articles and /articles/$slug with correct Markdown rendering (including images).
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can: load the new template, click “Save” to create the article, then toggle publish to “Published” without errors.
As an anonymous (logged-out) visitor, `/articles` lists the newly published article in the results.
As an anonymous (logged-out) visitor, navigating to `/articles/<new-template-slug>` renders the article title and Markdown content without runtime errors.
If the new article includes Markdown images, they render correctly using the existing Markdown image support (no broken layout).

file_operations.description: Tighten client-side cache invalidation after publish/unpublish so newly published content reliably appears on the public Articles index and any open article detail view (e.g., ensure relevant public article queries are invalidated/refetched after publish). Keep all user-facing text in English.

Verify the public Articles index continues to handle logged-out (anonymous) visitors cleanly and refreshes to include newly published articles after an admin publishes (no new routes/pages). Keep all user-facing UI text in English.

Verify the public article detail view renders a newly published article by slug for anonymous visitors without runtime errors, and that Markdown content (including any template image) renders via the existing MarkdownRenderer support. Keep all user-facing UI text in English.
